title: Federal Judge Blocks Gulf of Mexico Drilling Leases, Citing Environmental Concerns; The Interior Department sold the oil-and-gas leases in November, but they had yet to take effect
text:
Federal officials held the lease sale, which would have marked the largest offshore oil-and-gas lease sale in U.S. history, on Nov. 17 but hadn't allowed the leases to become effective yet, according to court papers. The leases could have taken effect as early as Feb. 1, court papers said.

Chevron Corp. identified itself in court papers as the highest bidder on several dozen tracts. A Chevron representative didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.

Write to Katy Stech Ferek at katherine.stech@wsj.com

Federal Judge Blocks Gulf of Mexico Drilling Leases, Citing Environmental Concerns
